headline: French Toast for One
description: This French toast covered in maple syrup and cinnamon makes a tasty, quick breakfast that's perfect when you're cooking for one.
name: French Toast for One

recipeInstructions.text: Combine milk, egg, salt, and vanilla extract in a shallow bowl. Dip both sides of each piece of bread in egg mixture.
Heat a large frying pan over medium-low heat. Add oil to the hot pan and cook both pieces of toast until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Top with maple syrup and sprinkle with cinnamon.

review.reviewBody: Changes made for delicious breakfast: Used heavy cream instead of milk Added pinch of brown sugar Used 3-day old King Arthur Easy Sandwich Bread Drizzled the extra marinade over the bread while the first side cooked
The one thing i would change is the amount of oil i tried using the 1 tbsp but it was way too much you just need a little bit otherwise it was delicious
The eggs fall of the bread when you cook it but I added extra milk and it was perfect! So yummy!
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??

- Took more than 2-3 minutes on each side. - It was more like scrambled eggs on a toast. - As soon as I put it on the frying pan the egg separated from the toast and I had a layer of white egg on the bottom of the toast. -After cooking it was not as moisturized as needed. It needed more quantities of all the ingredients. - I had to drench it in honey to cover the egg taste. - It doesn't make a mess which is good. - I topped it with some strawberry to make it taste better. There are definitely better recipes than this.
Nothing unique about this recipe. Same recipe in Better Homes and Gardens Cookbook, except ingredients cut in half to serve one.

Just the the way I like making French toast, with no sugar added to the egg mixture. I didn't measure out 1 tsp salt, just used a dash. I don't think a tablespoon of oil is needed to cook it in, just a teaspoon. Other than small personal preferences, this is a perfect recipe for 2 thick slices of bread or 3 thinner slices.
